Plot the Holobiont Redox Resilience Ternary Diagram

Source: R/plot_RRI_ternary.R
plot_RRI_ternary.Rd

This function visualizes holobiont redox resilience in ternary space, where each point represents the relative contribution of plant physiology, soil redox chemistry, and microbial resilience.

The input must contain compositional domain coordinates that sum to 1 per row. Rows with undefined compositions (e.g. all-zero domains or missing values) are automatically excluded.

plot_RRI_ternary(
  ternary_df,
  point_size = 5,
  point_alpha = 0.9,
  palette = "plasma",
  show_subtitle = TRUE,
  show_centroid = TRUE,
  centroid_shape = 23,
  centroid_size = 1.4,
  tolerance = 1e-06
)

Arguments

ternary_df

A data frame with columns Physio, Soil, Micro (compositional; sum to 1), and RRI.

point_size

Numeric. Point size (default: 5).

point_alpha

Numeric in (0,1]. Point transparency (default: 0.9).

palette

Character. Viridis palette option (default: "plasma").

show_subtitle

Logical. Show system-level mean RRI subtitle.

show_centroid

Logical. Overlay centroid (mean composition).

centroid_shape

Integer. Shape for centroid marker (default: 23).

centroid_size

Numeric. Size multiplier for centroid.

tolerance

Numeric. Closure tolerance (default: 1e-6).

Value

A ggtern plot object (inherits from ggplot2).

Details

Creates an ISME-style ternary plot of holobiont redox resilience based on compositional domain contributions (Physio, Soil, Micro) and filled by per-sample RRI.

Suggested packages

  • ggtern

  • ggplot2

  • viridis

Examples

sim <- simulate_redox_holobiont(seed = 1)

res <- rri_pipeline_st(
  ROS_flux = sim$ROS_flux,
  Eh_stability = sim$Eh_stability,
  micro_data = sim$micro_data,
  id = sim$id,
  direction_phys = "auto",
  direction_anchor_phys = "FvFm",
  direction_soil = "auto",
  direction_anchor_soil = "Eh"
)

plot_RRI_ternary(res$row_scores_comp)
#> Warning: Ignoring unknown aesthetics: z
